comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: Can someone please identify this building for me?  Is it New York City Hall?

comment.author: 37865451@N00
comment._content: Looks like city hall to me. cf. www.flickr.com/photos/chrisinphilly5448/493026437/sizes/o/

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: parkermulligan - thanks.  This building , or parts of it, feature as background to plenty of other scenes in the Bain collection.  I makes sense that City Hall would feature on many offcial occasions or receptions.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thanks for the good question, lifeasdaddy and thanks to parkermulligan for the identification of this building. As lifeasdaddy points out, City Hall appears in other Bain images such as this one: memory.loc.gov/service/pnp/ggbain/14100/14188v.jpg We will add the location to the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started a Wikipedia entry for him: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R.A.C._Smith Robert A.C. Smith (February 22, 1857 - July 27, 1933) was the Commissioner of Docks in New York City.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Thanks!  We'll also add the full names for Smith and Gaynor next time we update the description.
